page.title: 11NEWPORT LORD LOUIS LIBRARY
page.content: Opened in April 1981 by the Countess Mountbatten of Burma,the Lord Louis Library borders Church Litten Park across which the Pavilion shaped building can be viewed. The first and largest of the two pavilions houses the main lending library with a total of over 20,000 books, both fictional and non fictional.The second pavillion at the south end holds reference and local collections,over 12,000 books which can be consulted in the comfotably designed Reference Library. The two pavilions are joined by an extended corridor-this houses the Children's Library. Junior readers up to the age of 14 are encouraged to borrow from the 8000 books available. The Library aims to cater for the whole of the community by providing books for old peoples homes etc.
